title: How does studying philosophy benefit students in all aspects? - Quora

response.answer_text: Q. How does studying Philosophy benefit students in all aspects? (1) Thanks for the A2A. (2) As a student, learning, when decanted to its essence, serves four objectives. Trains you on where and how to source information and knowledge, and after sourcing, how to process the information and knowledge. Teach a man how to fish, and he’ll be fed for life.Trains you to think, looking at, pondering, analyzing things from different perspectives, different framesets, different paradigms, different consciousness.Teaches you subject matter, such as Math calculus, Chemical equations, WW2 history, Shakespeare’s The Taming of the Shrew.Self-discovery. Peel the onion that is you. Scientific talent. Love for the Humanities. You may be a future Nobel laureate. A Yo-Yo Ma.(3) Philosophy feeds into all four of the above. There’re is no absolute right or wrong in philosophy, so it’s a great cognitive ballpark to free-range and hone your thought process. You’ll meet a great number of thought-provoking philosophers, but no philosopher, none, has a monopoly on wisdom. Humbling. Philosophy touches all aspects of life: Everyday life, ethics/morals, religion, politics, science, math, art, linguistics, etc. Infinite opportunities to get exposure to human nature, and most of all, your human nature to idealise. An expansive discovery journey that starts and ends with you. Here’re some illustrations. (3a) Are you living your life right? Sam Qwato's answer to What is existentialism?Sam Qwato's answer to What are some life lessons learned through reading Nietzsche that are useful in other parts of life?(3b) Right or wrong? Sam Qwato's answer to If you know that out of 3 people, one of them was going to carry out a mass nuclear attack, is it ethical to lock all 3 up for life? Assume they are impervious to torture and the 2 innocent would not be harmed in the potential nuclear attack.Sam Qwato's answer to How can scientists morally and ethically justify inventing weapons that can kill and harm?(3c) For political animals Sam Qwato's answer to What are the classics of political philosophy?Sam Qwato's answer to Why are some Americans so opposed to universal healthcare?(3d) How do you know what you learn in school is reliable knowledge? Sam Qwato's answer to Who are the most famous philosophers of science?Sam Qwato's answer to How do you know that right now at some part of the universe some natural law is not being broken?(4) Philosophy makes you whole. It’s a structure, a kind of cage lowered around truth that if it is practiced extremely well lets it escape between the bars in huge amounts. Practiced badly - then the cage is a cage, confining & concentrated on for its own sake. Philosophy is of the conscious mind & that can get in the way of intuition which is the most direct path to our deepest intelligence, genius creativity, feeling & all most valuable. It needs to be used carefully. Everything is a necessary tension between order & chaos. Philosophy is of the former.

All aspects? It won’t make you physically healthier, it won’t make you taller, it won’t heighten your sensory perception. It will help with both qualitative analysis (e.g., critical reading, analytical writing) and, if you study formal philosophy, abstract and symbolic reasoning. It’s a great field to study.
